comment.text: The "Account name is empty" translation key is used to display an error message when a user attempts to save an empty account name in a portal renaming feature. This message appears in a dialog or input field validation context, prompting users to enter a valid name. Translators should ensure the text accurately reflects the intended meaning and usage.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, 'Името на профила е празно' translates more literally to 'The name of the profile is empty'. A more natural and user-friendly translation for 'Account name is empty' would be something like 'Име на акаунт липсва' or 'Липсва име на акаунт'.

The translation 'Nombre de cuenta está vacío' is a literal translation and not the most natural phrasing in Spanish. A more natural translation would be 'El nombre de la cuenta está vacío' or 'La cuenta no tiene nombre'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: El nombre de la cuenta está vacío

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Nom de compte est vide' is a literal translation but doesn't flow naturally in French. A more idiomatic translation would be preferred.
The Lao translation "ບັນຊີ ຊື່ ແມ່ນ ເປົ່າ" doesn't perfectly convey the English meaning "Account name is empty." A more accurate translation would reflect the possessive nature of 'Account name'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ບັນຊີຊື່ບໍ່ມີ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Não colocou um nome para a conta" is a literal translation but doesn't convey the same nuance as 'Account name is empty'. It implies the user didn't put a name, rather than the field being empty.

The translation 'Поле имя аккаунта не заполнено' is overly literal. A more natural and user-friendly translation would be 'Имя аккаунта не указано' or 'Введите имя аккаунта'. The current translation includes 'Поле', which is not typical for this type of error message.

The translation 'ගිණුමේ නම හිස්ය' while literally meaning 'Account name is empty', sounds awkward and unnatural in Sinhala. A more natural phrasing would be 'ගිණුම හැදෑරීමට නම අවශ්‍යයි' or 'ගිණුමට නම ලබා දෙන්න'.

The translation 'Име налога је празно' is a literal translation of 'Account name is empty' but might not be the most natural way to express this in Serbian. It's overly formal. A more common and user-friendly translation would be something like 'Назив рачуна је празан'.

The translation 'Ime naloga je prazno' doesn't accurately convey the meaning of 'Account name is empty.' 'Naloga' is closer to 'account' but 'Ime' (name) doesn't quite fit. A more natural translation would involve using a word that conveys the concept of a 'name' or 'title' associated with an account.
The translation 'Ім'я облікового запису порожнє' while technically accurate, is a bit literal and clunky. A more natural Ukrainian phrasing would improve the user experience.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'Введіть назву облікового запису' (Enter account name) or 'Назва облікового запису не вказана' (Account name not specified).
